newsitem.title: MONGOLIA: Mongolia copper production up 1.5 percent in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Mongolia copper production up 1.5 percent in 1996.

text.p: Mongolia produced 346,400 tonnes of copper concentrate in 1996, up 1.5 percent from the year before, the State Statistics Centre said in a report made available on Sunday.
Mongolia also produced 5.242 tonnes of gold in 1996, up 16.38 percent from the year before, the report said.
The north Asian nation exported 486,100 tonnes of copper concentrate last year, up 8.9 percent from 1995, the report said.
Most exports of copper concentrate were to Russia, it said.
Exports of mineral products totalled $250.14 million in 1996, down from $309.97 million in 1995, it said.
Mongolia exported $14.93 million worth of base metals and their products last year, dropping from the $17.07 million in 1995, it said but gave no further details.
